@graph.caption: Cauliflower tortitas are cauliflower tempura bites in a spicy chipotle-tomato sauce.

@graph.name: Vegan Cauliflower Tempura Bites « Dora's Table
@graph.description: This recipe for vegan cauliflower tempura bites in a spicy tomato-chipotle sauce is a satisfying and crunchy dish. The batter has no eggs!

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Vegan Cauliflower Tempura Bites
@graph.description: These vegan cauliflower tempura bites (cauliflower tortitas) in a tomato-chipotle sauce are one of my favorite lent side dishes. Traditionally the tortitas are dropped in an egg batter and fried, but for this version of the batter, I've essentially made an eggless tempura batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Place all the ingredients for the sauce in the blender and process until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Place all the ingredients for the sauce in the blender and process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring sauce to a simmer in a sauce pot set to medium heat. Simmer for 5-7 minutes, season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring sauce to a simmer in a sauce pot set to medium heat. Simmer for 5-7 minutes, season with salt and pepper. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Sift the flour and cornstarch into a large bowl. Add the salt and soda water. Whisk until combined. The batter should have the consistency of a thick pancake batter. Add more water as necessary.
recipeInstructions.name: Sift the flour and cornstarch into a large bowl. Add the salt and soda water. Whisk until combined. The batter should have the consistency of a thick pancake batter. Add more water as necessary.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven to 350°F.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven to 350°F.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the oil is hot, use your hands to drop the cauliflower in the batter and then into the oil. Fry for 2-3 min. on each side or until the batter is crispy and slightly golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the oil is hot, use your hands to drop the cauliflower in the batter and then into the oil. Fry for 2-3 min. on each side or until the batter is crispy and slightly golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oil and place on a plate or tray lined with paper towels. Serve with spicy tomato sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oil and place on a plate or tray lined with paper towels. Serve with spicy tomato sauce.

@graph.keywords: cauliflower tempura, mexican tempura bites, tempura veggies, vegan tempura
